page.title: 02ATTITUDES Changing Times (1)
page.content: {Mr.John Dann}has known{Blackboys} for just over 50 years. "When I was young I had a Saturday gardening job which paid 2 old pence an hour. In the evenings we went to the club on the recreation ground to play billards.Or we would cycle to the tin-shed roofed cinema in Heathfield. You could hear the trains running through the tunnel underneath.Now people watch television or travel in their cars to find entertainment.The railway station and cinema have gone. We had few holidays, whilst today people travel all over the world.We played football and cricket.Blackboys used to have a windmill.One old boy could hit a ball for six over the top of it!Today we have badminton, squash, stoolball and lots more." (Angela Baker,Catrin Lewis, David Robbins.)
